definition: the result (becomes apparent)/now one understands
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
the result becomes apparent/(after) the dust has settled

sentences.english: They will call a press conference as soon as the results are known.
sentences.chinese: 结果一见分晓，他们将立即举行记者招待会。

sentences.english: It remains to be seen who will be the victor in the contest。
sentences.chinese: 谁将在这场比赛中获胜还有待分晓。

sentences.english: The larger the more people see the outcome.
I suppose the miracle will be apparent tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我想这个奇迹明天就会见分晓。

sentences.english: Well, all the turns aren't in.
sentences.chinese: 不过，还没有最后见分晓。

sentences.english: The jury's still out on Reynolds, at least as far as I'm concerned.
sentences.chinese: 就我看来，对于瑞诺兹的表演，至少还有待分晓。

sentences.english: It remains to be seen whether Rose wants to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯是否希望同他见面，尚待以后见分晓。

sentences.english: The outcome of the matter is still uncertain.

definition: the result becomes apparent/(after) the dust has settled
to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
to make a decision/to determine
relative superiority (better or worse, stronger or weaker, above or below etc)
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom)/the truth comes to light
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
victory or defeat/result
lit. to wipe one's eyes and wait (idiom); to wait and see
a tie-break/to determine the winner
to meet again/until we meet again/goodbye
future days/(literary) the next day/(old) past days
wait and see (who is right)
foresight/prescience
at that (future) time
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
